alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 27 at 10:01PM CDT until October 28 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Widespread sub-freezing temperatures as cold as 22 to 29 degrees expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While mid to high level clouds will increase into Saturday morning, possibly stabilizing a temperature drop, the thickest clouds are anticipated to focus north and west of those areas yet to experience a hard freeze this fall. As a result, by Saturday morning the entire Warning area will likely have registered at least one, if not a few hard freezes already this fall, effectively ending the 2023 growing season area-wide and making additional Freeze Warnings unnecessary.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
